summary: This document is an FBI electronic communication requesting analytical assistance regarding telephone toll records related to Jeffrey Epstein. It details an ongoing federal investigation into Epstein's recruitment of underage females for sexual activities, highlighting the use of telephone communications to arrange these encounters.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the central figure in the investigation, accused of recruiting underage females for sexual activities.

persons.name: Eliasib Ortiz Jr
persons.context: Eliasib Ortiz Jr is mentioned as the approving agent for the communication regarding the investigation.

persons.name: E. Nesbitt Kuyrkendall
persons.context: E. Nesbitt Kuyrkendall drafted the communication and is involved in the investigation.

persons.name: Lydia M. Hughes
persons.context: Lydia M. Hughes is mentioned as a recipient of the communication.

connections.description: E. Nesbitt Kuyrkendall is investigating Jeffrey Epstein's alleged crimes.
Eliasib Ortiz Jr is the approving agent for the communication drafted by E. Nesbitt Kuyrkendall.

events.title: Request for Analytical Assistance
events.description: The FBI requested analytical assistance regarding telephone toll records related to Jeffrey Epstein's case.

keyFacts: The document discusses an ongoing federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's recruitment of underage females for sexual activities.
Underage females were reportedly paid by Epstein to perform massages that involved sexual acts.
The investigation focuses on telephone communications used to arrange these encounters, particularly those involving Epstein's personal assistant.
Telephone toll records from 2004 and 2005 are being analyzed to identify contacts with underage victims.
The document includes a request for assistance in analyzing the frequency of calls made to underage females.
